  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35080].
  {panel}

If you upload a pptx file into a Confluence page you will get the following error:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!

Into the atlassian-confluence.log you will get below stack trace:
{code}
 -- referer: http://confluence:8090/display/TEST/Test+pttx | url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
2014-09-25 11:15:22,901 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-3] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : junk.pptx with page number 0, waited : 300, now executing in background.

2014-09-25 11:15:23,216 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting junk.pptx
 -- referer: http://confluence:8090/display/TEST/Test+pttx | url: /plugins/servlet/pptslide | userName: admin
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "f0"
	at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.readJavaFormatString(FloatingDecimal.java:1241)
	at java.lang.Double.parseDouble(Double.java:540)
	at com.benryan.escher.XmlCustomShapeRenderer.getDouble(XmlCustomShapeRenderer.java:170)
	at com.benryan.escher.XmlCustomShapeRenderer.convertPoint(XmlCustomShapeRenderer.java:165)
	at com.benryan.escher.XmlCustomShapeRenderer.renderCustomShape(XmlCustomShapeRenderer.java:83)
	at com.benryan.escher.EscherRenderer.renderAutoshape(EscherRenderer.java:551)
	at com.benryan.escher.EscherRenderer.walkShapes(EscherRenderer.java:233)
	at com.benryan.ppt.PptRenderer.render(PptRenderer.java:125)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PPtDocumentConversionTask.convertFile(PPtDocumentConversionTask.java:56)
	at com.benryan.conversion.PPtDocumentConversionTask.convertFile(PPtDocumentConversionTask.java:27)
	at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:50)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2014-09-25 11:15:26,274 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-3] [jersey.spi.inject.Errors] processErrorMessages The following warnings have been detected with resource and/or provider classes:
  WARNING: A HTTP GET method, public javax.ws.rs.core.Response com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin.rest.DraftsResource.getDrafts(int,int), should not consume any entity.
 -- referer: http://confluence:8090/display/TEST/Test+pttx | url: /rest/tinymce/1/content/2228226.json | userName: admin
{code}

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Setup a Confluence 5.6.3.
# Create a test page.
# Drag and drop the example attachment added in the restricted comment (it's for internal use only).
# Save the page.

h4. Notes:
* The power point file was created in Office 2013.
* Office Connector version 3.3.8 (latest on Confluence 5.6.3)
* We don't know which specific configuration causes this error.

h4. Additional information
The error occurs on this pptx ([link|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1104238/1104238_WG_GlobalPres_template_del_001+%281%29.pptx]) as well.
However, once the pptx is modified by 'Save As' PowerPoint 97-2003 Presentation (.ppt) or PowerPoint Picture Presentation (.pptx), it can be displayed successfully.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35077].
  {panel}

h3. Step to reproduce:
# Create a table with 30 row.
# Fill all the table row with some word
#  Highlight one of the row  and click the JIRA issue icon
# Select the option {{Create X issues from this table}} 
# Then select create.

+Expected result+
New JIRA issue will be created in JIRA project and the link will be added in the Confluence page.

+Observed result+
New JIRA issues are created in JIRA project however no link are added in the Confleunce page. Sometimes the process will hang and you are force to refresh the page. An error is displayed: {quote}X issues have been created, but there are problems in adding them to the page.
You can manually add them later using JIRA macro.{quote}

The following will appear in the logs as well:
{code}
2014-09-17 13:16:09,661 WARN [http-bio-8091-exec-1] [internal.integration.jira.DefaultJiraService] communicateWithJira Problem communicating with JIRA
 -- referer: http://new.com/display/WEB/test | url: /teamsite/rest/jira-integration/1.0/issues | userName: van.ly
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:376)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:161)
{code}


h3.Workaround
The only available workaround is to manually add JIRA issue links to the page.
fields.summary: No JIRA issue link will be created in Confluence page when creating a large amount of JIRA issue from pages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35050].
  {panel}

In Confluence, when the user wants to insert more than one JIRA macro, you can use the option to put it as a table, like the screenshot below:

!table.png!

However, in cases like this one, the column for "Issue Type ( T )" and the "Priority ( P )" are only displayed with the first letter, which could confuse the users that doesn't know the name of this value. It would be awesome if we could manually rename it or have it already completed. 

The same for the icons in the issue Type: since sometimes the users doesn't understand the icon, a configuration option should be available to print out the whole value, such as "Story", "Epic", or "Bug" versus just an unknown icon.
fields.summary: Ability to Change the Column Names for JIRA Macro

fields.description:
In Confluence Page edit mode, left-clicking the button 'View In JIRA' of JIRA Issue will open the JIRA instance in new tab. However, right-clicking the button 'View In JIRA' and selecting Open In New Tab will only duplicate the current page instead of opening JIRA instance

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a new Confluence Page
# Insert a JIRA issue macro
# Click the JIRA issue macro to show the buttons
# Right-click View in JIRA button (see [^jiramacro.png]), select Open in New Tab
fields.summary: View In JIRA Button Cannot Be Opened In New Tab By Right Clicking

fields.description:
Confluence excludes a dependency on xml-apis:xml-apis-ext, which works for the limited case of using batik through antisamy, but it breaks many other valid uses for these libraries.

To work around this, plugins have to bundle their own copies of all 3 batik libraries confluence exports from its system bundle, and enough xml-apis jars to load all of it from the plugin classloader (making what would otherwise be a ~500KB plugin instead be 6MB+). This risks pulling in all of their dependencies as well, bloating the plugin even further.
fields.summary: Apache Batik libraries exported from core unusable by plugins

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35040].
  {panel}

*Related*
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24883 (similar issue)
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34870 (slow page move increases window of deadlock)

*Suggested fix(es)*
* Have single (cluster wide) queue for page move operation
* Hold (cluster) composite lock (parentID:childId), or do two locks in natural ordering (parentId -< childId).

*Side effect of this bug*
* Page Tree cycling eternally and causes OOM in under few minutes.
* breadcrumbs hits stackoverflow
* other plugins (indexing?) are not guaranteed to handle cyclic graphs in confluence.

*Symptoms*:
nginx:
{noformat}
172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:40:43 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2302876189&position=append&targetId=2298943959&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436432399 HTTP/1.0" 200 271 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"
172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:40:44 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2302876189&position=above&targetId=2298943959&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436436617 HTTP/1.0" 200 271 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"
172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:40:45 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2298943959&position=append&targetId=2302876189&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436439759 HTTP/1.0" 200 265 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"
172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:41:04 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2301533426&position=below&targetId=2302876189&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436461303 HTTP/1.0" 200 297 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"
172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:41:06 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2301533426&position=above&targetId=2298943959&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436465795 HTTP/1.0" 200 297 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"
{noformat}

App log(full version attached): 
{noformat}
2014-09-22 20:40:44,397 ERROR [catalina-exec-10] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ERROR: deadlock detected
  Detail: Process 29730 waits for ShareLock on transaction 2482659; blocked by process 14749.
Process 14749 waits for ShareLock on transaction 2482650; blocked by process 29730.
  Hint: See server log for query details.

fields.description:
Increasing the logging level of "com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.dailysummary"  to "ALL" does not print the TRACE entried in the logs. 

Workaround:
- Shutdown Confluence
- Navigate to {{<Confluence installation directory>/Confluence/WEB-INF/classes}} and open *log4j.properties*
- Replace {{log4j.appender.confluencelog.Threshold=DEBUG}} with {{log4j.appender.confluencelog.Threshold=ALL}}
- Add {{log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.dailysummary=ALL}}
- Start Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35037].
  {panel}

Complete themes can be created and applied to an individual Confluence space, but it requires a moderate to large amount of time and technical knowledge to do so. Confluence would benefit from a way to quickly and easily "brand" a space visually.

h5. Work in progress
I've attached a mockup showing some early thinking we've done. This is _not_ final, but does show you one of our current ideas about how this could work.

You'd be able to:
* Apply a banner across the top of the Space Homepage
* Have it shown in a stylised view at the top of the sidebar
* Have the option to turn the Space avatar off completely in the sidebar

As you can see, this gives plenty of room to put much richer branding across the space.

h5. Feedback
We'd love to get general feedback on how useful this would be overall and to answer some specific questions:
* Would you like to see the banner on all pages in the space, or just the home page?
* Is the opaque stylised treatment applied to the banner acceptable to those with branding guidelines to meet?
* Would you want to keep the space name or have it turn off along with the space logo?
fields.summary: Ability to quickly brand a space

I am attempting to evaluate Confluence 5.6 using Windows 64 bit trial installer. I follow the recommended settings and the Confluence application is set up on my box. Launching in my browser, I see the Confluence set up screen, but when I try to request a trial license, I find the entire application has hung and is non-responsive. The service will not respond and killing and restarting it leaves it in an unresponsive state (web pages load forever, the setup screen is inaccessible)

After uninstalling, restarting, and reinstalling, I tried opening the setup page in a different browser and discovered that every time I refreshed the page I was greeted with a tomcat error:

Error creating bean with name 'i18NBean' defined in class path resource [i18NContext.xml]: Instantiation of bean failed

I've attached the entire stack to this issue.

I have reproduced this issue on two of two machines I've tried.

I do not have this issue while working with a trial of Jira.

Please notify me on potential fix for this or if new installers become available as this prevents me from trying the product

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35015].
  {panel}

Rendering errors with macros and pages need to be improved in several key ways:

#. page render timeouts show no page contents at all. On page render timeout, we should show any page content we managed to collect so far, with a banner above mentioning the timeout, and a banner below mentioning rendering was aborted at this point.
#. macro render timeouts show no contents of the macro body. On macro render timeout, we should show a banner where the macro should be saying the macro timed out, any macro body content we've rendered so far, and another banner indicating the macro rendering aborted at this point.
#. any other macro rendering failures show no contents of the macro body either. On macro errors (e.g. macro not found) we should render the macro body contents anyway. This will make it easier for users to view what content they might be missing when macros are broken, and avoid the need to rewrite pages when macros are temporarily disabled.
fields.summary: Robust macro rendering

  {panel}

When creating a mirror image for testing purposes of our Jira instance, we then need to delete the application link to the Production instance of Confluence.
This then breaks the application link between our Production Jira and Production Confluences as well.
The only solution that has worked is to delete then re-add the application links on both sides (same URL as was there in the first place).
However:
Jira macros in Confluence display "Error rendering macro 'jira' : Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration".

Steps to fix:
1. Edit page
2. Edit macro
3. The macro still contains the issue number. Click the magnifying glass, re-find the correct issue.
4. Save page.

Since the macro is saving the issue number, and the Jira link is the same (just re-adding it), I shouldn't have to go through every Confluence page containing a Jira macro just to re-find information that's already populated in it. 
Ideal behavior is for the macro to take the existing search query it contains and search in the new application link for it, THEN issue an error if it can't find it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34994].
  {panel}

If try to import a xml backup from a Confluence A to a Confluence B with a user that exist in both instances your mentions macros will get broken due a non existing user_key.
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Set up Confluence and create a user (eg Jessie Jones: jjones)
 # Create a page under a dummy space
 -- Add a \{noformat} macro to the page - this step is required because the issue only occurs if there is CDATA elsewhere on the page.
 -- Mention jjones.
 # Generate an xml export of the space
 # Delete the space from the instance
 # Open entities.xml and find the userkey for jjones, and modify it so it is different to the userkey in the system. Make sure you modify every occurrance.
 # Import the space back into Confluence
 # You will see that the mentions will be broken:
 !broken_link.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround prior to import
 # Open the zip file and edit entities.xml
 # Find all occurrences of {{]] >}} (note the space)
 # Replace with {{]]]]><![CDATA[>}}
 # Import the space

h4. Workaround after import

For a full update of your instance, see [User mentions appear as Broken link after XML import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/User+mentions+appear+as+Broken+link+after+XML+import]

For update of individual entries, read on.
 # Shutdown Confluence B.
 # Run below query against *Confluence A* database:
{code:java}select * from user_mapping
where username = 'jjones';
{code}
(i) Above example is jjones but you will need to use the user name of the user that got the broken mention.
 # Copy the user_key.
 # Now run below query against *Confluence B*
{code:java}select * from user_mapping
where username = 'jjones';
{code}
(i) Above example is jjones but you will need to use the user name of the user that got the broken mention.
 # Copy the user key.
 # At this point we will have two user keys for user jjones, one from *Confluence A* and the other for *Confluence B*.
 # Now Run the following query against *Confluence B* database:
 (!) Backup *Confluence B* before doing the update query
{code:java}UPDATE BODYCONTENT 
SET BODY = CAST(replace (cast(BODY as nvarchar(max)), 'user key from step 3' , 'user key from step 5') as ntext)
where BODY like '%user key from step 3%';
{code}
(i) The above query was designed to MS SQL Server, if you are using other databases like Oracle/Postegres/MySQL as your DBA to adapt the query.
 # Start Confluence B, check for the broken macros again (it should be resolved).
 # If you notice any otehr problems or the macros did not got resolved then shutdown Confluence and rollback your database using the backup taken before the update procedure.

h4. Workaround after import if the original system is not accessible
NB: This workaround requires the original export file for reference.
# As an administrator, go to the page and click '...' and View Storage Format. 
# Grab the value of ri:userkey, eg {{ri:userkey="40288ac6444668f70144466ab1e70003"}}
# Open entities.xml from the export file
# Search for the userkey. You will find a ConfluenceUserImpl object that looks like this:
{code} <object class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
<id name="key"><![CDATA[8a81818556b603360156b603fad80002]]></id>
<property name="name"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>
<property name="lowerName"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>
</object>{code}
# Inside the name property you will find the username, in this case it is 'admin': {{<property name="name"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>}}
# Edit the page and change the mention to that username

h4. Notes:

The reason why this happens it's because the mention macro uses the user_key to make the reference to the target user instead of the username.
{code:java}<ri:user ri:userkey="40288ac6444668f70144466ab1e70003"/>
{code}
During the import Confluence will not identify that jjones exist in both instances and that the source user_key needs to be updated with the target user_key.

This will only happen with Confluence instances on version 5.2.3 and latest since previous versions relies on the username instead of the user_key.
fields.summary: Mentions broken after space xml Import

fields.description:
Don't use Copy Page function for copying restricted pages. If the space is watched (through Space watch and RSS); notifications are sent even if restrictions are set that should inhibit such notifications.

To reproduce:
1. Restrict viewing for a page to some individuals.

2. Log in with an account that is not allowed to see the page. Watch the space containing the page (through Space watch and RSS).

3. Log in with an account that has viewing access and editing permission for the page. Copy the page.

4.The watcher will be notified although the watcher has no viewing permission.

Expectation:
If a a page viewing restriction is set, it is also applied to page copies before notifications are sent.

Technical issue: 
It seems that page restrictions are set or checked after (instead of before) the copy-page notification is generated.

fields.description:
When updating a Code Block Macro into a page from a saved template, If you attempt to save or update the text in the macro it deletes the macro.

EXE:
# go to: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SPRTHUB/_Creating+A+Knowledge+Base+Article
# Pick A KB space to create
# The Code block at the top of the template has the text *"FILL IN LOG"*
# Either:
- Highlight and Delete the text
- Highlight and Paste in new text
 
h3.Expected Behavior:
Text removed from macro and on paste new text is added to code block Macro

h3.Actual Behavior:
Code Block is deleted,  and when pasteing
fields.summary: Removing default text in code block deletes code block

fields.description:
I get an "application with id 'null' not found" after creating an application link between confluence and jura.

These are the steps:
-) My application links in confluence are empty.
-) When I create a link to my jira instance I get redirected to jira and back to confluence. So for so good
-) after the link is created and the application links page refreshes in confluence I see the link and an error message "application with id 'null' is not found"

I checked issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33908 and it states that I should create an issue. So here it is.

jira version = 6.2.7
confluence version = 5.5.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34973].
  {panel}

For non-english speaking customers the translation process in Confluence is always a bit annoying. I know that the Translation plugin supports us translating tokens on a page but not all terms are covered.
It should be easy to provide a user interface for admins/translators in the admin area displaying all terms in Confluence not translated to a specific language and offering a form to translate/update them.

||English Term||Translated Term||
|Child Pages| |
|Create Child Page| |
|Pages|Seiten|
...
||Update.. ||
fields.summary: Translation handling
Allow Global Space Templates to be Promoted - so can be viewed in specific spaces

fields.description: When a user resumes to edit a page draft which he has restricted before, the restrictions are displayed correctly in the editor toolbar. But when a user resumes to edit a blog draft which has been restricted before, the restrictions are lost. This inconsistent behaviour can be very confusing for users and should be fixed in my opinion.
fields.summary: Restrictions are lost, when a user resumes to edit a blog draft which has been restricted before

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create some "Share a link" blueprints
# Nagivate to "Shared Links" page
# Click "Edit", and edit {{Page properties report}}.
# Change "Number of items to display" to a number lower than the number of "share a link" blueprints you have created.
# Save the page
# Use Confluence as an anonymous user, and navigate to "Shared Links" page

h4.Expected Results:
User should be able to click on Next page to check all the shared links

h4.Actual Results:
When user clicks on Next or page number nothing happens.

h4.Findings:
This issue does not happen for logged in users.

h4.Workaround:
Click "Edit", and edit {{Page properties report}} to change "Number of items to display" to a higher value so all the links are displayed in one page.
fields.summary: Anonymous users are unable to navigate to "Next" page in "Shared Links"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34968].
  {panel}

When installing the JDBC jar file it must be installed in:
<Confluence installation>/lib

I had placed the driver in the originally indicated directory and continued to get the error: could not find driver with class name com.mysql.jdbc.driver

After referring to this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+MySQL+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat
it refers to:
Copy the JAR file into the lib folder of your Tomcat installation: <TOMCAT-INSTALLATION>/lib.

Applying this logic, I stopped the Confluence service, copyed the jar to <install>/lib, restarted confluence, no more error and I'm able to proceed with the install.

I am installing Confluence 5.5.6 from ZIP.
(5.6.1 install does not allow external database connection during setup)
fields.summary: <Confluence installation>         /confluence/WEB-INF/lib

fields.description:
I've tried to move pages two different ways:
Click the Tools button, click Move.
When I type in the new Parent Page name, it finds the new page, and appears to move the page sucessfully. However, once I click the Move button, the page goes back to its original place.

Second way: Click Tools, click View in Hierarchy. I move the page, and it appears to be moved in the heirarchy. Once I close out of the hierarchy, however, the page is back in its original location.

This does NOT happen in all pages. It's happened with the following pages:

http://wiki/display/techwiki/Product+Feature+-+Eligibility+and+Benefits+-+Service+Types+-+Draft
http://wiki/display/techwiki/Configuring+Patient+Search+Criteria+-+DRAFT
fields.summary: Can't move pages

fields.description:
When you try to move an attachment from a page to a new one that haves a colon ( : ) in the title, Confluence will not allow you to do it with the following message:

!colon.png!

The expected behaviour should be to only move the attachment without messages.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with Colon in the title (e.g. A Page with Colon: Testing)
# Create *other* page in the same space
# Insert a new attachment to the page (Edit > Insert > Attachment)
!attachment.png!
# Once you do this, click on *Save*
# Access the attachments information (Tools > Attachments)
!tools.png!
# Select the *properties* option in the right side of the attachment
!properties.png*
# Insert the page with colon name in the *Page* field
!field.png!
# Hit the *Save* button and the message will be displayed

h3.Workaround

Simply just remove the colon from the title of the page.
fields.summary: Unable to Move Attachments to Pages Having a Colon in Title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34956].
  {panel}

Hi there!

Some time ago we faced the needed to update the Copy Space plugin. 
We wanted it to copy PDF Layout&Stylesheet and Space Layout to the new space.
And we've found the answer at Atlassian Bitbucket  https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/confluence-copy-space-plugin/pull-requests  (pull requests #2 and #3) and compiled a new jar.

Don't you plan to make this functionality default for the plugin? It it quite useful. We have tested the changes and all works great  (only the checkbox "Copy Space Layout" is needed as for pdf settings). 

Many thanks for Confluence, guys, it helps us much =)
fields.summary: Confluence Copy Space

fields.description:
Only the theme for the last code macro on a page gets applied to all code macros' elements on it.

Repro steps ...

* add a blank page
* add a code macro select e.g. "Confluence" theme
* add another code macro beneath, select e.g. "RDark" theme

... upon preview or save see all macros gone "dark".
fields.summary: Code Macro Does Not Apply Selected Theme

fields.description:
According to [Restoring a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Space]:
{quote}
Note 2: You cannot restore to a different major Confluence version

Confluence only supports compatibility for space import and export when executed within the same major version of Confluence. (This issue is logged as [CONF-26111|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26111].)
{quote}

However, {{Confluence Admin > Backup & Restore}} shows:
!restore-space.png!

This could result in confusion.
fields.summary: Backup & Restore shows that users can import space backups from different major versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary Search does not return pages that have the search terms in code blocks. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page # Add this content (from comment below) !screenshot-1.png! And *source format* of {code:java}

purple unicorn

orange badger

movable slothtitular blog

protractor yarn

 {code} h3. Expected Results Search matches any word in the page. h3. Actual Results Results of searching each individual term: +Normal text+ purple - yes unicorn - yes orange - yes badger - yes +Code block - no title+ (code) coder - yes (code) zebra - no +Code block - title+ (title) movable - no (title) sloth - no (code) melodious - no (code) lion - yes +Note - title+ (title) titular - no (title) bog - no (note) protractor - yes (note) yarn - yes h3. Notes Mostly fixed in Confluence 5.10.2. Only titles are missing. !CONF_34941-Confluence5102.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround No workaround (except putting the text in the page outside a code macro)

fields.description:
h3. Step to Reproduce:
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# Add an  Activity Stream Gadget into JIRA
# Attach an image into Confluence Page.

All the attachment from Confluence are rendered in Full size  however the image from JIRA  are rendered as thumbnail. This is  inconsistent and the Confluence Activity Stream should render the image as thumbnail as well since the user does not need to see the full size of the image in the activity stream.  (!) This does not affect Confluence 5.1.x and below.



!sample.png!
fields.summary: Image from Confluence Activity stream not rendered as thumbnail.
